alert.note: Alert for Morgan (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 09 at 9:54PM EDT until May 10 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in West Virginia... Cacapon River near Great Cacapon affecting Morgan County. For the Cacapon River...including Great Cacapon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cacapon River near Great Cacapon. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Rock Ford Road begins to flood in multiple locations, including flowing completely over the low water bridge. Constant Run Road and a small portion of Kilgore Road also begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EDT Monday the stage was 9.7 feet, or 0.7 feet above flood stage. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM EDT Monday was 11.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow morning and continue falling to 6.5 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.7 feet on 02/23/1971. - Please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information. && River Name Fld Observed Tue Tue Tue Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 2AM 8AM 2PM Stg Time Date Cacapon River Great Cacapon 9.0 9.7 Mon 9 pm 9.3 9.0 8.7 MSG unknown &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued by Tuesday morning at 1000 AM EDT.
